text: Chief Data and Artificial Intelligence Officer
sentence: Obliges the Chief Data and Artificial Intelligence Officer to develop policies for a combatant command warfighter forum on AI, considering purposes such as AI tool use cases, risk categorization, and training needs.

Establishes AI Safety Level (ASL) Standards to guide safe deployment and security for current and future AI models, categorizing measures into Deployment and Security Standards.
Requires all current models to meet ASL-2 standards, focusing on safe usage and protection from unauthorized access.

Introduces Capability Thresholds to determine when stronger safeguards (ASL-3 or higher) are needed, specifying Required Safeguards for particular risks including Chemical, Biological, Radiological, and Nuclear (CBRN) capabilities and Autonomous AI R&D.
Mandates comprehensive assessments to ensure models remain below Capability Thresholds, with stricter ASL-3 standards implemented if thresholds are surpassed.
Outlines internal governance practices including a Responsible Scaling Officer role, transparency measures, and procedures for noncompliance whistleblowing.
Commits to public transparency, expert input, and notifying US Government if standards beyond ASL-2 are needed.
Outlines civil penalties for violations, including a fine up to $1,000, with enforcement authority granted exclusively to the Attorney General.

text: Section 236 of the FY 2021 National Defense Authorization Act
sentence: Amends Section 236 of the FY 2021 National Defense Authorization Act by adding the Director of National Intelligence as an official that can, with the Secretary of Defense, establish a steering committee on emerging technology and national security and receive recommendations from the committee.

text: Principal Deputy Director of National Intelligence
sentence: Amends members of the steering committee to consist of the Principal Deputy Director of National Intelligence, the Deputy Sector of Defense, the Vice Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staffs, and other appropriate officials.

text: Vice Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff
sentence: Amends members of the steering committee to consist of the Principal Deputy Director of National Intelligence, the Deputy Sector of Defense, the Vice Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staffs, and other appropriate officials.

Adds that the Steering Committee shall be chaired by the Deputy Secretary of Defense, the Vice Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, and the Principal Deputy Director of National Intelligence jointly.

Amends the responsibilities of the steering committee by clarifying that the committee's strategy is to maintain the technological superiority of both the US military and intelligence community according to not only the National Defense Strategy, but also the National Intelligence Strategy and the National Security Strategy.

Amends the responsibilities of the steering committee by clarifying that the committee's strategy is to maintain the technological superiority of both the US military and intelligence community according to not only the National Defense Strategy, but also the National Intelligence Strategy and the National Security Strategy.

Amends the responsibilities of the steering committee by clarifying that the committee's strategy is to maintain the technological superiority of both the US military and intelligence community according to not only the National Defense Strategy, but also the National Intelligence Strategy and the National Security Strategy.

Adds that the steering committee is responsible for making recommendations on any changes to the guidance for developing the National Intelligence Program budget and determining whether sufficient resources are available for the intelligence community, in addition to the Department of Defense, to defeat threats to the US.
Adds the definition of intelligence community from the National Security Act of 1947.
Mandates the Secretary of Defense to expand the Digital On-Demand Program to all organizations and elements, Armed Forces members, and civilian employees within the Department of Defense.

text: Senate and House Armed Services Committees
sentence: Obligates the Secretary of Defense to submit a progress report to the Senate and House Armed Services Committees within 180 days of enactment and annually through 2029.

text: Director of the United States Patent and Trademark Office
sentence: Mandates the Secretary of Homeland Security to consult with the Director of the National Institute of Standards and Technology and the Director of the United States Patent and Trademark Office within eight months to develop an AI watermark and trademark system for identifying Federal agency-approved AI applications for civilian agency use.
Requires the Board to adjust the issuance threshold for inflation every four years.
Directs NSF to support research on wildland fire risks, tools, technologies, and the social and economic factors influencing fire risk reduction.
Requires FEMA to support community risk assessment tools, public outreach, and best practices for fire-resistant construction and response.
Directs NASA to support wildland fire research, modeling, data systems, and the development of novel monitoring tools.
Instructs EPA to research wildland fire smoke characteristics, impacts on air and water quality, and communication of risk reduction strategies.
Mandates DOE to develop tools for energy sector resilience to wildland fires and coordinate data resources for improved fire understanding and prevention.

text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate
sentence: Requires the Secretary to provide the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure and the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives with a quarterly briefing on the pilot program.

Requires the Secretary to provide the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure and the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives with a quarterly briefing on the pilot program.

text: Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives
sentence: Requires the Secretary to provide the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure and the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives with a quarterly briefing on the pilot program.

Requires the Secretary of the Department of Homeland Security to conduct a pilot program to assess the potential for the autonomous, or remotely controlled, operation and monitoring of certain Coast Guard vessels.

Requires the Secretary to submit to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure and the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives a final report assessing the execution of the pilot program and its implications for preserving safety and environmental quality.
